AD.synopsis: Volo will have some casual behavior around camp. One of these behaviors is to wander over to a druid's tame bear and try to talk to it.

individual_metadata.synopsis: Volo is a canonical character in DnD. He's known for being the realm's go-to guy for compiling information. In this take, he fulfils that role but puts a twist on what he sees. He's keenly curious for facts but likes to embellish them. A bit like Gilderoy Lockheart. He IS talented, but his reputation has gotten away from him, too. In this dialogue, Volo will offer to put his knowledge at your service if you confide you've been infected with a mindflayer. He'll perform an icepick lobotomy that'll leave you without an eye or much in the way of apology from Volo. He should be clever, a little arrogant, very English, and very fun, without being a cartoon character.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to Volo near the sacred pool in the druids’ grove (253 516).

Bear.synopsis: Bear in the druid grove. This is a Speak with Animals dialogue. If Volo is there, we sense his frustration at trying to communicate with Volo (who has been asking him questions in an AD). If Volo isn't there, he wants to know who we are. He gets scared of us when we tell him about the tadpole.

automatic_ordering.reasoning:
1. The session 'AD' features Volo interacting with a bear in the druid's grove. For 'Bear' to occur, Volo must be present; thus, 'AD' should precede 'Bear'. 
2. The session '' (Volo's offer of assistance) requires you to speak to Volo in a specific location. Since Volo's dialogue is foundational to his character, it should logically occur before any interactions with animals or other characters in the grove, including 'AD' and 'Bear'. 
3. Therefore, '' should come before both 'AD' and 'Bear'. 
4. There are no mutual exclusivity conditions found in the provided sessions.

AD_2.speaker: Volo
AD_2.text: Would that we could speak freely, my ursine friend!
AD_2.context: NodeContext: Pleading with theatrical, wistful flair

AD_7.speaker: Volo
AD_7.text: Alas, I've never learned to converse with your kind.
AD_7.context: NodeContext: Pleading with theatrical, wistful flair

AD_3.speaker: Volo
AD_3.text: I smell drama amongst these so-called adventurers. What have you heard?
AD_3.context: NodeContext: Searching for some hot gossip.

AD_9.speaker: Bosk
AD_9.context: NodeContext: The bear isn't saying anything.

AD_6.speaker: Volo
AD_6.text: Keep their confidence, if you insist.
AD_6.context: NodeContext: With flair and good-natured theatricality.

AD_5.speaker: Volo
AD_5.context: NodeContext: REacting to bear noises as though bear is explaining something to him.

AD_8.speaker: Volo
AD_8.text: Ah, I do wish I could understand you!
AD_8.context: NodeContext: REacting to bear noises as though bear is explaining something to him.

AD_13.speaker: Volo
AD_13.text: Ah, my grizzled friend! What can you tell me about this place?
AD_13.context: NodeContext: Approaching bear, looking for conversation

AD_0.speaker: Volo
AD_0.text: Yes, yes, I see. And is that 'grr' with two 'r's or one?
AD_0.context: NodeContext: Reacing to 'grr'. Volo is being dumb.

29.speaker: Volo
29.text: Pardon me! Must prepare to travel - good day, my friend!

78.speaker: Volo
78.text: To the goblins camped nearby, of course. I've been tracing their doings with great care.

38.speaker: Volo
38.text: Whoever this 'Absolute' they're worshipping might be, I'll be the first to write about it.
38.context: NodeContext: Determined-- he's a man with a scoop he intends to follow.

88.speaker: Volo
88.text: ...I'll tell you, if you'd be so good as to answer a few questions pertaining to the goblins you encountered at the gates.
88.context: NodeContext: Trying to entice the player.

51.speaker: Volo
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's holding a book and a quill, scribbling notations when he notices you.NodeContext: He's holding a book and a quill, scribbling notations when he notices you. He's happy to see you, he has questions for you!

67.speaker: Volo
67.text: If I were less educated, I'd presume to ask what you're doing on the Sword Coast.
67.context: NodeContext: He's being friendlty and coy, trying to get an answer without asking it.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Then, for your own sake, your education is fortunate indeed.

91.speaker: Volo
91.text: Indeed! Some merciless kin of yours made sure of that, some years ago.
91.context: NodeContext: Remembering a bad situation with a chuckle.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You seem more familiar with githyanki than most around here.

87.speaker: Volo
87.text: You're hardly my first, my friend. With a curious mind and a good pair of walking shoes, one makes many an acquaintance.
87.context: NodeContext: Hardly his first githyanki he's met. He's being cheeky and arrogant.

92.speaker: Volo
92.text: Though, at present, my curiosity lies elsewhere than the vagaries of the children of Gith.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: What I'm doing is none of your concern.

55.speaker: Volo
55.text: Naturally. I wouldn't pry, no matter the temptation. It's just...
55.context: NodeContext: He's just about to start intensely prying.

46.speaker: Volo
46.text: Forgive my surprise. It's rare to find your kind above ground. Rare and intriguing on a day already packed with intrigue!

59.speaker: Volo
59.text: You were at the gates just now, no? When the goblins came? You saw them up close?
59.context: NodeContext: He's about to start quizzing you on what you saw. Eager.

36.speaker: Volo
36.text: A few questions, if you please. There's no overstating my interest.
36.context: NodeContext: He wants to write down what you'll say. Enthusiastic.

20.speaker: Volo
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's ready to write, quill to book.NodeContext: Player agreed to answer his questions. He's happy but also arrogant, like a rich old person saying 'you're an absolute DOLL' when you do a minor favor for them.

81.speaker: Volo
81.text: How would you describe that particular batch of goblins? Size? Nature? Distinguishing qualities?
81.context: NodeContext: Quizzing the player, looking for info for his book. He's more professional here, curious.

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *You search your mind, successfully recalling various details of goblin behaviour.*

57.speaker: Player
57.text: A classic raid gang, complete with lasher and smattering of booyahgs.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Common variety goblins, led by a lasher and flanked by booyahgs.

9.speaker: Volo
9.text: My! A scholar after my own heart. Spent much time among goblins?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: The time was spent among books. I'm a student of the page.

2.speaker: Volo
2.text: Aha! I've always preferred experience to the second-hand accounts of lesser men. But to each their own!

50.speaker: Volo
50.text: Now I've a few more questions, if you don't mind.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I'd rather not say. Are we done here?

84.speaker: Volo
84.text: Far be it from me to pry! Now, as you were saying... lasher... booyahg...
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in a notebook.NodeContext: Volo is writing down a highly sensationalised version of what the player is saying. At the end, he's satisfied and ready to continue with his questioning.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I'm not unfamiliar with their kind, certainly.

22.speaker: Volo
22.text: Shocking little creatures, aren't they? Still, there's quite a bit more to them than most accounts allow.

63.speaker: Volo
63.text: I myself plan to record the world's most extensive catalogue of their means and habits. A blue ocean of information, I daresay.

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *You search your mind, but remember nothing useful about goblin social order or behaviour.*

43.speaker: Player
43.text: They were goblins, same as all the others: lowly and vile.

34.speaker: Volo
34.text: 'Goblins... struck... fear... and... awe... in... heart... of... wilting... witness...'
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in notebookNodeContext: Volo is writing down a highly sensationalised version of what the player is saying. At the end, he's satisfied and ready to continue with his questioning.

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: A myth-weaver. This man has no respect for truth.

23.speaker: Volo
23.text: And the... dragon they had marching in the rear. Was it of the brass or silver variety?
23.context: NodeContext: Volo is bullshitting. There was no dragon and he knows it. But he's stating it to the player as though he believes it.

62.speaker: Volo
62.text: 'Witnesses... failed... to... notice the... obvious... dragon...'
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in notebookNodeContext: Response to 'I told him there was no dragon.' Volo's sensationalizing again.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Heh - it was brass. No doubt about it.

52.speaker: Volo
52.text: 'Witness... mistook... obvious... silver... dragon... for... brass...'
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in notebookNodeContext: Response to 'I said it was a brass dragon.' Volo is bullshitting.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I think there's been a misunderstanding. What do you want, exactly?

37.speaker: Volo
37.text: The truth, my friend! Not a jot more or less!
37.context: NodeContext: Response to 'What are you getting at.' Volo doesn't really want the truth but he believes in his own morality.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Are you drunk or merely stupid?

83.speaker: Volo
83.text: 'Witness... declined... to... comment... on... nature... of... dragon...'
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in notebookNodeContext: REsponse to 'I asked if he was drunk or simply stupid'

48.speaker: Player
48.text: A brass or silver dragon would die a million deaths before allying with goblins.

10.speaker: Volo
10.text: 'Witnesses... noticed... red... dragon... marching... at... rear...'
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in bookNodeContext: Emphasis on 'Red,' because the player said there would never be a Brass or Silver dragon with goblins

86.speaker: Volo
86.text: Last question, then you'll be quite free. Did the attackers rally to 'the Absolute' when they fell upon the gates?
86.context: NodeContext: He's wrapping things up, in full journalism mode.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Yes - they called out the name like a war cry.

12.speaker: Volo
12.text: They did, didn't they? Oh-ho, curious. Curious indeed.
12.context: NodeContext: Answers that yes, the goblins used the word 'Absolute'. He's very interested in this; very intrigued. Your confirmation is exactly what he wanted to hear.

53.speaker: Volo
53.text: I've interrogated one - a captive in this very camp. She reports they've abandoned their god Maglubiyet in favour of someone called 'the Absolute'.

90.speaker: Volo
90.context: NodeContext: Hissed like he's just conveyed a very juicy bit of gossip

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Goblin superstition - not worth the ink and parchment.

77.speaker: Volo
77.text: Ah, but is superstition all? These goblins are informed by a kind of strategy anathema to their kind.
77.context: NodeContext: He finds this VERY interesting.

100.speaker: Volo
100.text: Never you mind. I'm on my way to their camp as we speak. I always knew my studies in Ghukliak would come to some use.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: What do you think Maglubiyet makes of this change?

13.speaker: Volo
13.text: Oh, I'd imagine him quite displeased.
13.context: NodeContext: Like he's conveying a bit of juicy gossip.

72.speaker: Volo
72.text: Since their change in allegiance, these goblins are informed by a kind of strategy anathema to their kind.
72.context: NodeContext: He finds this VERY interesting.

99.speaker: Volo
99.text: I, for one, intend to get to the bottom of it.

71.speaker: Volo
71.text: I'm just preparing to head to their camp as we speak. In fact... if you'll excuse me, I ought not to dawdle.
71.context: NodeContext: Eager to end the conversation with you.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Be careful. Goblins aren't known for mercy.

33.speaker: Volo
33.text: Never you mind. Who needs mercy when you've a quick tongue? (And an invisibility potion stashed in your back pocket.)
33.context: NodeContext: Flippant and proud of his own cleverness.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Wait. About our conversation earlier - why the dragon?

32.speaker: Volo
32.text: My friend, every story benefits from a dragon.

19.speaker: Volo
19.context: NodeContext: Extravagant, ready to be done with you.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: What brought you to the wilds in the first place?

66.speaker: Volo
66.text: Why, goblins, obviously. Someone ought to chronicle these curious events.
66.context: NodeContext: He's telling you something he believes is very obvious.

82.speaker: Volo
82.text: I'd heard the master of this place - a druid called Halsin - might be able to point me in the right direction.

61.speaker: Volo
61.text: But! He's been quite captured by them already. Ironic, really.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I don't think so. I was concentrating on not dying.

18.speaker: Volo
18.text: Really? Well, this does complicate things... but then again... well, never mind.
18.context: NodeContext: Player says goblins didn't invoke 'the Absolute.' Volo is turning the idea around in his head, trying to figure it out. A man in thought.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Quite so. They sang the phrase like a battle-hymn.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Neither! It was a gold dragon, scales glittering and wings gleaming.

80.speaker: Volo
80.context: NodeContext: Super enthusiastic. He knows I'm lying but loves it.

14.speaker: Volo
14.text: Thank heaven you were here to specify, or I might have recorded a boldfaced lie!

65.speaker: Player
65.text: There's dragon blood in my veins. I'd know if one of my forebears had been there.

60.speaker: Volo
60.text: 'Witness... believes themselves... to be... dragon... possibly... deluded...'
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in bookNodeContext: Sceptical. Emphasis on himself/herself/themselves in line

58.speaker: Volo
58.text: 'Goblins... were... of... rare... gem-coloured... hue... and... wielded... magic... blowguns...' Right!
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in notebookNodeContext: Volo is writing down a highly sensationalised version of what the player is saying. At the end, he's satisfied and ready to continue with his questioning.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Didn't you see the tentacled ship? It was an illithid invasion force - the goblins were being controlled!

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Goblins? Hardly. They were shapeshifted devas!

8.speaker: Volo
8.text: Ye gods! Can it be? How terribly... compelling...
8.context: NodeContext: Player just told Volo an obvious lie, but Volo is into it. He wants sensation, not facts.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: And there's no overstating my disinterest. I've no time for questions.

54.speaker: Volo
54.text: I'll make it very quick, hand to heart.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Best if he really puts his hand to his heart.NodeContext: Trying to strike a deal. His friendliness is skin-deep.

Bear_1.speaker: Bosk
Bear_1.text: Just a moment - this man is recording my story.

Bear_17.speaker: Bosk
Bear_17.context: NodeContext: Articulating very clearly - he's trying to make someone who can't speak with animals understand what he's saying.

Bear_20.speaker: Narrator
Bear_20.text: *As the colourful man starts scribbling, the bear sneaks a quick look at the page.*
Bear_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Volo is excited, writing on the page. The bear leans in to see what he's writing.

Bear_19.speaker: Narrator
Bear_19.text: *His brow furrows. Incomprehensible squiggles surround a crude sketch: a bear disembowelling a clutch of tieflings.*

Bear_3.speaker: Bosk
Bear_3.text: You're curious - you've got a great many odours about you. What happened to you?
Bear_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear sits back to listen to you.

Bear_16.speaker: Player
Bear_16.text: That's a complicated story. I doubt you'd understand.

Bear_2.speaker: Narrator
Bear_2.text: *He listens, rapt, hanging on every word.*

Bear_8.speaker: Bosk
Bear_8.text: The city sounds like rot. You're better off right here.

Bear_7.speaker: Bosk
Bear_7.text: You ate... a big orb? Curious. It's best not to overindulge, no matter how delectable the morsel.

Bear_12.speaker: Bosk
Bear_12.text: You'll learn, boy. Give it some time.

Bear_5.speaker: Bosk
Bear_5.text: That's frightening. I'm glad you made it here. Things are strange right now, but it's no - what did you call it? - Blood War.

Bear_9.speaker: Bosk
Bear_9.text: You've got spirit, doing all that for a goddess. I hope she returns your efforts in kind.

Bear_18.speaker: Bosk
Bear_18.text: That sounds... cold. I'm glad you're here now, in the sun.

Bear_11.speaker: Bosk
Bear_11.text: Selûne's Tears... it must be beautiful to live there.

Bear_15.speaker: Narrator
Bear_15.text: *As you near the end of your tale, you see his attention drift as he licks his lips, thinking about something else entirely.*

Bear_13.speaker: Narrator
Bear_13.text: *The bear is preoccupied with a shiny pebble. Your presence goes unnoticed.*

Bear_14.speaker: Bosk
Bear_14.text: Come on... all the druids can understand me, you can - why can't the man with the pen?

Bear_0.speaker: Bosk
Bear_0.context: NodeContext: Articulating very clearly - he's trying to make someone who can't speak with animals understand what he's saying.

Bear_21.speaker: Narrator
Bear_21.text: *The man nods thoughtfully and adds another dismembered limb to his sketch.*
